all but one of the mummies on display were previously interned above the ground only one was buried below ground and so is much more decomposed with no skin remaining some of the bodies are quite recent from the 20th century many have body hair which apparently still grows even after death there are children as well as adult mummies a woman who apparently died while pregnant is displayed with her child another woman who may have been pronounced dead by a doctor after having an epileptic seizure is said to have been interned alive not for the faint of heart

incluso si el museo lleva los colores de la trampa al turista las momias y su historia son impresionantes solo creemos que es muy costoso para una visita tan breve y eso nos lleva a otro rincon de la ciudad es facil llegar en autobus si puedes encontrar el autobus que tomar

el visitar este museo te deja la impresion de transportarte a otra epoca conoces la historia de las personas que fueron preservadas para ser exhibidas en este museo y conoces detalles de lo que fueron en su vida
tienen las momias bien conservadas bien presentadas y el recorrido es interesante

Titulo: museo de las momias unusual and interesting
Opinion: we combined a visit to the mummy museum with one to the exhacienda de san gabriel de barrera in marfil this famous mummy exhibit is not for the faint of heart or those bothered by images of the dead from my research i discovered that some of the bodies that have become the mummies of guanajuato were buried in 1833 as a result of a cholera epidemic many of these bodies were buried immediately to control the spread of the disease in some cases the dying were buried alive by accident as a result some of the mummies have horrific expressions attesting to their death in the tombs mexican law required families either to pay for or rent burial space in guanajuatos cemetery if these rents went unpaid for three years the bodies were disinterred to make room for more recent dead of the many bodies disinterred only two percent were mummified no one knows why but one possibility is the dry climate combined with the chemicals in the soil in 1865 the first mummified body in the cemetery of santa paula pantheon was exhumed that of doctor remigio leroy he was gradually joined by around 118 others who now reside in the museo de las momias this museum also has the smallest mummy in the world a six month old fetus from a pregnant woman who died form cholera some of the mummies can be seen still wearing parts of their clothing its very strange to see a mummy wearing only socks andor shoes mummies of varying ages are here from infants to the elderly a special display contains the bodies of the very young dressed as angelitos tiny angels apparently according to the museums director in rural mexico now as in the past infant catholic girls who die are often dressed as little angels or angelitas in lacy dresses and sometimes with angel wings to represent their young souls freedom from sin and their presence with god boys are dressed as little saints or santitos the color of their clothing corresponding to the saint representing the month in which the boy died the dressed infants are displayed for a brief time and photographed alone or with their families as if they are still alive although this small museum can often be packed with tourists on our visit we had the place almost to ourselves since most people were at pope benedicts address in cubilete bonus we also checked out the small additional display of torture implements however this was like a very poor carnival haunted house and not worth the extra pesos the cost to enter the mummy museum was 54 pesos each about 4

one of the most amazing museums you will ever see in your life can be found in guanajuato mexico the mummies are the preserved remains of former guanajuato residents many can be viewed in the remains of the clothes they were buried in these are well preserved exhumed bodies dug up due to economic reasons relatives couldnt pay to keep them interred we visited a nearby cemetery outside of dolores hidalgo to see if this could be true and they even have a sign at the entrance stating that if you dont make payments on your deceased love ones grave they can be exhumed the museum may have to add on another wing keeping an open mind we didnt find it all offensive just extremely quirky i have been to the museum twice and would go again i would highly recommend visiting the cemeteries they are absolutely beautiful especially the one just outside of dolores hidalgo its about an hour from the capital of guanajuato i guarantee this whole experience will be one of most amazing things youve ever seen

as part of tour we went to the mummy museum we really enjoyed this very interesting museum if youre squeamish then its not the place for you if not and especially if you work in medicine like us you will really enjoy this the bodies are better mummified than any other we have seen around the world this museum is more expensive than others here so i wouldnt recommend going if the thought makes you nauseated

fuimos al museo hace unas semanas lo tienen muy bien cuidado la verdad creo lo remodelaron hace poco la cuestion es que esperabamos que un guia nos explicara todo el proceso de momificacion o historias de como obtuvieron las momias lo que obtuvimos fue una introduccion de unos cuantos minutos a la entrada del recorrido narrado por un video lo que mas impacto fueron las momias de unos bebes eso fue algo desagradable a la vista
pues el museo muestra varias momias es increible ver como han quedado a traves del tiempo y como se conservan asi interesante pero te entra el nervio

this museum made the list in a book that suggested 1000 things to do before you die the conditions of the soil in guanajuato are perfect for preserving dead bodies and many are on display i found it fascinating they arent wrapped in the style of egyptian mummies nor are they as ancient the young children and babies on display were sad but it was worth the trip
remodelaron el lugar y las momias estan bien cuidadas
algo diferente pero muy interesante
es una buena opcion para visitar sin embargo si van con poco tiempo pueden dejarla como ultima opcion de visita amable la gente del museo y es una opcion contratar a un guia

entrar a este museo es algo que no ves en cualquier otro lugar personas que alguna ves recorrieron las calles de guanajuato y que ahora las ves inertes detras de una vitrina no diria que es una visita obligada en guanajuato ya que tiene miles de ofertas mas para el turista pero ya que como dije anteriormente no es algo que puedes ver en cualquier lugar te recomiendo visitarlo
en este lugar se pueden ver momias de diferentes personas que son conservadas perfectamente debido a las caracteristicas del suelo de este lugar si te gustan los museos esto es interesante de verse

Titulo: not one of my favorite attractions but certainly different
Opinion: first of all if you are hoping to see mummies in the egyptian style you will be disappointed because that is not what you are going to find here the soil in guanajuato apparently mummifies in that it dries out without decay some of the corpses that are buried in the cemetery and some of these are what are on display in the mummy museum i was told that if the families dont keep their cemetery fees up the bodies are exhumed and if they are mummified they may be placed in the museum i found the museum interesting at first but for me it was just too much the museum is the sort of attraction where one enters at one end and threads ones way throughout the entire facility before being able to exit at the other end i would have enjoyed it more had i been able to enter see two or three of the mummies so as to view the phenomenon and then been able to exit being able to see one or two of these mummies would have completely satisfied my curiosity because honestly one isnt that much different from another and for me the experience became quite gruesome especially when i considered why these people had been disinterred and were on display

Titulo: i expected more but if your in town squeeze it in
Opinion: this attraction was interesting but i expected more the history of these mummies are very interesting in that they are displayed in there natural state wearing the exact clothes they were buried in one had the original coffin still intact i found the history and stories of who these mummies were most interesting and the museum does a fair job of explaining the history of whom these people were so if you want to just see mummiesthan this is a good exhibition if you want more history and explanationsinformation than dont get your hopes up because in my opinion they just gloss over the information they have a cemetery attached to the museum which i was told you could walk through which was false also they included a human torture exhibit for more pesos i cant remember the amount with in the museum which i passed on you can cover the whole museum in under an hour so if you are short on time than this is great to get inout fast and see other things the beautiful city of guanajuato has to offer there are shops around the museum and they charge you a few pesos to park there no big deal also the bathrooms are outside that you can use for a few pesos so for me this was a been there done attraction to check off the list
una cantidad de gente enorme pero se avanza rapidamente y pues es casi obligado visitar en guanajuato un museo diferente

es una experiencia fabulosa aunque causa un poco de miedo ver a cada una de las momias con su historia las expresiones la postura y ver aun la ropa con la que fueron enterradas es increible en lo particular me quede asombrada y con un poco de escalofrios

Titulo: my husband just had to go
Opinion: its a long hike up from the city but you can take the bus expensive for what it was but interesting and strange one reviewer says the momias are naked and people should be warned i am not sure what they were expecting these were people whose families couldnt afford the fees to keep their loved ones in the cemetery so the mummifieddue to the dry air and soil type bodies were taken out and stored clothing is optional in burial especially since a living family member might be able to use them i am glad that the momias are protected behind glass as people were actually touching them when they were first exhibited and taking bits of their hair etc

Titulo: tienes que visitar uno de los distintivos mas importantes de guanajuato
Opinion: a mi me encanta todo lo relacionado con el terror y este es un lugar perfecto para estar cerca de ello cada momia tiene su historia durante el recorrido te acompanara un guia que hara mas amena tu visita esta muy cerca de la zona centro viajando en auto o camion y el precio es justo pero ojo este es el verdadero museo de las momias no se dejen enganar por falsos guias de turistas que te llevan a otros museos donde las momias son de cartones en serio solo pidan ayuda de guias calificados

one of the wonders of the worldthe mummy museum is at firststartling then very enlightening and worth the visit there are 119 mummified remains of menwomen and children even the smallest mummy of a child go before you have lunch fascinating

in the category of im here so i guess i have to go not the most convenient location on a hill west of the center so go by taxi unless you like the walk the museum will not likely take very long unless you have some kids in tow who will no doubt be fascinated by this somewhat unseemly display of paupers remains from the 19th century
sugiero que las autoridades se preocupen por tener mas limpia la ciudad los centros de mayor afluencia tener personal que de forma permanente mantengan sin basura

cuando lo visite me senti como en una pelicula del santo el lugar es obviamente frio y relativamente con poca luz el ambiente se siente un poco lugubre pero es emocionante recorrer el lugar sobretodo escuchando la explicacion del guia acerca de las momias mas representativas como la de la mujer embarazada
the mummy museum is very unique as it has dozens of mummified human remains on display its a must see for both young and old
you have to see the mummys you cannot leave without seeing them

preparate a ver estas momias desde sus vitrinas con los relatos amenos de un guia divisando cada detalle de cada momia ahora esta muy moderno yo tuve la oportunidad de conocerlo a los 12 anos y el camino para llegar a cada vitrina donde se encontraban era para dar miedo porque no tenias espacio entre ellas o la pared o la vitrina con la cara enfrente de la momiasus muecas poquisima luz para no danar su conservacion todo tan lugubre con ganas de regresar a pasar por ese miedo
esta vez que fui a las momias era para recordar mi ninez pero ahora vi mucho menos momias dicen que estan de viaje pero es un lugar que uno no se puede perder cuando vayan a guanajuato

es de las cosas que debes ver por lo menos una vez por ser algo tan emblematico de guanajuato sin embargo hay que ir cuando uno tenga mucho tiempo ya que es larga la espera con ver la primera y la ultima momia te das por bien servido y hay muchas otras cosas mucho mas atractivas en esta ciudad hermosa
aqui se exhibe la momia viajera que es la segunda momia mejor conservada del mundo y ha estado en exposiciones en distintas partes del globo

el museo no tiene ya nada de espectacular nadie respeta lo de no tomar fotos o video uno acude para que los ninos conozcan sino no vale la pena no pague los 15 pesos de la otra exibicion es una estafa
es desagradable ver como se conservan las momias no me gusto

Titulo: de lo tradicional a lo comercial
Opinion: desafortunadamente lo que antes era un paseo lleno de misterio lleno de curiosidad para los ninos y adultos se ha vuelto muy comercial el recorrido cada vez es mas corto y menos la cantidad de momias para apreciarlas se nos apura por parte de los guias y no se aprecia a detalle a las protagonistas de ese sitio
macabre but interesting to learn about the stories of these mummies what is missing is an explanation of what caused these bodies to mummify needed to ask one of the ticket takers
en realidad las momias estan en cuartos muy pequenos los espacios reducidos no permiten contemplar lo que esta expuesto tenia otras expectativas
el museo cumple con lo que promete sin embargo recomiendo no ir en temporada alta ya que las filas son enormes
vae la pena visitar este museo es algo diferente
esta por demas decir y pensar en que todas estas personas se conservan en tan buen estado me gustaria seguier ese plan

pues fuimos un grupo de amigos a visitar el famoso mueseo de las momias para nuestra sorpresa nos encontramos que tienen a las momias muy descuidadas algunas hasta con hongos puesto que es uno de los sitios mas visitados en guanadjuato creo que las autoridades deberian invertir un poco mas en el museo para darles algo de mantenimiento y tener a las pobres momias en mejores condiciones a un lado del museo de las momias hay otra exposicion sobre la muerte o algo asi la verdad no la recomiendo para nada no gasten su dinero en esa exposicion las momias pues interesante solo el hecho de que las tienen en condiciones muy desfavorables

el museo no esta mal pero para mi gusto se aplico demasiado grueso y al mismo tiempo no hay suficiente informacion hay muchos cadaveres no son momias en el verdadero sentido de la palabra pero no aprenderas nada sobre tecnicas de momificacion ni nada por el estilo es decir todas las exhibiciones son momias desempaquetadas que fueron bien preservadas por coincidencias favorables pero no se puede maravillar con las momias empaquetadas el cadaver mas pequeno de mexico que encontre es demasiado macabro he aqui un feto que aparece junto a su madre embarazada la idea y el tema no son malos pero la implementacion no es optima en mi opinion
es padrisimo ver las primeras tecnicas para conservar el cuerpo humano desde hace siglos

the mummy musem is grosteque and extraordinary maybe you wont like seeing the bodies but i wouldnt have missed it a cultural thing that some will hate some like me will love i highly recommend it for those who like something different
la verdad es increible estar ahi pero tenia como 7 anos cuando fui y como que no lo disfrute mucho que digamos ahora despues de 25 anos anhelo con ansia regresar

ya antes de entrar cuando te cuentan la historia de como los cuerpos se momifican naturalmente enterrados en la montana y que los cuerpos que se encuentran en exposicion son de personas cuyas familias no pudieron pagar la cuota de la sepultura te dan una mezcla de curiosidad y pena cuando entras el museo es tan impresionante como escalofriante es realmente increible no lo aconsejo para personas impresionables sobre todo el sector de bebes y ninos

el interior del edificio esta bien sin una fotografia flash esta bien pero deje de tomar fotos de la frescura de la momia la tumba se desenterrara y se convertira en una exhibicion como esta muchas momias estan escalonadas y finalmente alineadas varia de momias de bebe a momias viejas tambien puedes comprar especialidades especiales de muiraame en guanajuato aunque puedes comprarlas excepto aqui debido a que es la famosa atraccion turistica de guanajuato a los que no son buenos para las momias se les recomienda que sean visitados por todos los medios pero aquellos que piensan que es un mal hobby pueden no querer ir
es un lugar que no es de mucho interes para visitar y que no representa mayor cosa de atractivo

Titulo: should come with a warning sign

we took the mummy tour as everyone says it is the thing to see i thought it was very interesting but i also felt like it was invasive to the dead to some degree most people did not seem to feel that way but i just wondered how these mummies on display would react if they had a voice especially since learning that some were from the 1960s one baby on display even had plastic pants over the cloth diaper kind of a strange item to be buried in as there are no worries about a diaper leak after death there were signs prohibiting photos but everyone ignored the rule and the tour guide made no obvious objections

posiblemente junto al teatro juarez y la alhondiga uno de los lugares de visita obligada es interesante ver la conservacion que mantienen de las momias muy buen trabajo en ello para mi gusto no es un lugar que tienes que visitar en varias ocasiones

the museum is pretty expensive but is well worth the entry there are two attractions here i recommend skipping the corridor of the cult of the dead a fairground style horror house and just going to the mummies this will save you time and money
this place is super super disturbing but a must see at the same time pubic hair on mummies almost made me vomit but the whole experience is amazing ill probably never like to go again tho
muy bien saber y conocer la historia y nuestras raices y una explicacion muy buena e interesante de nuestro guia guanajuato es un estado maravilloso lo recomiendo ampliamente
impresionante que despues de tanto tiempo se conserven en magnifico estado
es padre el museo pero demasiado tiempo tienes que esperar para entrar
me gusto mucho es una experiencia muy singular pero me dio un poco de grima por los cadaveres aun y cuando estan momificados
no hay muchas momias pero es muy interesante tambien visiten la otra sala de la muerte
a very unsettling museum but worth the trip full of mexican tourists
el trato con los turistas es de buen profesionalismo los guias excelentes muy amables y atentos fue una visita obligada para quien va a guanajuato
un lugar tipico de guanajuato aun que particularmente no es nada agradable pero estan en buen estado
natural mummification occurs in the soil around guanajuato the museum is small but they have several mummies on display interesting

the museum is rather hokey in its manner of displaying these mummies some of whom are less that 60 years from their deaths kind of ghoulish their existence is an interesting phenomenon by why the display if you go from mid historic district take a cab there are a lot of hills between the two
seen one youve seen them all not worth the trek out of centro nor the admission price

if gto is known for one thing throughout mexico its the mummies this slightly macabre collection of past residents is fascinating in its own waythese are not the linen wrapped egyptian type you see them just as they were interred recently renovated the museum should be on your to do list of once in a lifetime experiences i dont recommend it for young children though
es un lugar impactante y lleno de misticismo recomiendo ir tambien al camposanto que esta arriba

Titulo: hay menos momias que en anos anteriores
Opinion: esta remodelado las momias ahora se encuentran en vitrinas de cristales impresionante verlas tan cerca asi como te muestran la momia mas pequena lo que me sorprendio es que hay menos momias visite este lugar hace 7 anos y habian mas la entrada cuesta 52 pesos por persona vale la pena conocerlo es un lugar representativo de guanajuato
recibimos una esplendida atencion y el guia fue muy explicito el museo ha mejorado sus instalaciones y los cambios son muy favorables en horabuena
real mummies with hair clothes smiles a very strange and unique museum that kids really like

Titulo: vaya esto si que es interesante
Opinion: realmente no tenia pensado visitar el museo pero estando ya en guanajuato me tente mucho me hubiera arrepentido si no hubiera ido ya que los expuesto es muy interesante recorrer sus pasillos apreciando las diversas momias hacen tomar conciencia de las costumbres y cultura del pueblo azteca no dejen de visitarlo

Titulo: ya no estan completas las momias
Opinion: resulta que mediante un convenio sospechoso se prestaron varias momias creo que andan en eeuu y como habia mucha gente solo te dan cuando mucho 20 o 30 minutos para hacer medio recorrido aunque uno paga boleto completo
yes there are a number of well preserved mummies dont think you will see anything like this anywhere else in the world
no son momias sino personas muertas y exhumadas que por el particular clima seco de la zona se quedan asi se visita mas por curiosidad pero no me parece nada de interesante
i do not think it is worth the ride to see people that have been dead for 30100 years

Titulo: pequeno museo con un tema interesante y raro
Opinion: en un dia sin guias esta tan vacio que estas solo en el pequeno museo el museo en si es una antigua catacumba en la montana el aire es tan calido y seco que los cuerpos fueron preservados aqui las momias son muy roidas a excepcion de un hombre bien conservado con personalidad real tambien hay cadaveres de ninos y bebes pague el bano fuera del museo
padre quizas te esperas algo mas espectacular pero es bastante rico en contenido

Titulo: un museo curioso que refleja la mistica de mexico y profunda creencia sobre la muerte
Opinion: si bien la causa de las momificaciones que parecen en el museo son mas por la situacion climatica de la zona y de la forma de sepultar a sus muertos es importante destacar la cultura y el arraigo lo bien tenido del museo el guia gratuito pero que te atiende con esmero ademas el pueblo es muy autoctono con mucho colorido y unico con mucha historia arquitectura y tradicion el museo de las momias agrega la mistica que le faltaba y esta alineado con la tradicion mexicana y su creencia y respeto por la muerte

Titulo: they just dried up over the years
Opinion: its like the world biggest ball of twine an other thing you can check off your things to see list nicely displayed bodies of dead people that mummified over the years how can you not want to see that

my friend from mexico who i was traveling with wanted to see this display of clothed mummies it was very crowded with groups of children visiting as well as many others at the time we were there i saw no gringos in attendance my friend was very interesed in the display and saw nothing wrong with it i on the other hand found that it was just too much for my refined sensibilies about death im squeamish i guess the display is grotesque but strangely captivating

este museo ciertamente no se adapta a todos las momias que se muestran alli son un tanto aterradoras y no menos las de los cadaveres de los ninos las momias no son cuerpos embalsamados o preparados de otro modo sino muertos cuyos cuerpos fueron enterrados en el cementerio local como es normal pero debido a que es muy pequeno los cadaveres se exhuman cuando nadie paga la tumba sin embargo la calidad del suelo en guanajuatio es tal que los cuerpos no se descomponen adecuadamente los cuerpos mejor conservados se muestran en el museo los otros se queman el museo realmente no persigue un proposito educativo o cientifico hay muy pocas explicaciones en definitiva el programa sirve sobre todo el sensacionalismo por otro lado rara vez es malo lidiar con la muerte entonces por que no mirar estos cuerpos algunos de los cuales son bastante espectaculares cualquiera que no tenga preocupaciones morales obtendra el valor de su dinero aqui sugerencia a menudo se ofrece una visita al museo en guanajuato como parte de una excursion de un dia completo que incluye una visita a una mina antigua etc estas visitas no son realmente valiosas en mi opinion si desea ver el museo lo mejor es tomar un taxi alli y hacer el resto

Titulo: overpriced limited exhibition but can say you saw it
Opinion: this museums unique draw of mummified human remains is worth the trip assuming you know that its overpriced by more than twice compared to other museums in the city you need to take a taxi as its not in the historic center where most of the other sights are and actually has very few exhiibited remains so you go through in about 20 minutes or less some descriptions are in english and actually quite funny which is a surprise given some of the earlier fearful comments i was braced to be shocked but maybe because of them i found it not at all shocking but rather interesting

a waiter at our hotel warned us to avoid this museum but i had to see what the big deal was i should have listened to him folks all this is is some dead bodies they smell bad and look like hell i normally find bad taste amusing but this was beyond the pale there were even dead babies on display every one of those childrens deaths broke someones heart cant the municipal authorities just give these poor souls a decent burial nauseating and ghoulish take a cab to the exhacienda san gabriel instead

Titulo: not for the faint of heart
Opinion: wow ive wanted to visit this museum for a long time and finally did on a rcent trip to the area its really unusual because the mommies are dressed in their burial clothes and they present a sort of time capsule of a past age shoes socks dreesed and pantsand extremely grotesque facial expressions make this a real experience i found it fascinating but the people with me found it disturbing you decide

i returned to guanajuato after an absence of 43 years determined to see this iconic museum well known to all mexicans from the time they are schoolchildren less so to foreigners one reason for the popularity of this museum has to do with mexicans fascination with death right up there with the argentinians the museum has a limited number of exhibits that are well laid out if you want a glimpse into the mexican psyche youve got to make a pilgrimage to this place

im not normally into the whole museumcathedralarchitecture thing but this was an exception the museum itself is not big or mindblowing however it makes for a fun day triphow often do you get to take a look at human plasters youll get a few laughs in also take time to wander around the very local town its a refreshing sensation of being in the middleofnowhere

first of all you have to have an interest in these types of things in order to appreciate this museum for me it was a great experience i went on a twoweek school trip to guanajuato while there we visited this museum it was definitely one of the best museums we visited guanajuato is filled with all things horror scary and dead this museum fits in well almost all of the displays are real and mesmorizing the idea of knowing that the body you are looking at is a hundred years old is indescribable yes while here you will see many baby mummies everything is extremely fascinating my only regret is not taking my time in the museum because i was in a group i was rushed as some people started to get impatient i recommend visiting i plan on going to guanajuato sometime again in the future and this museum will definitely be on my itinerary i cant wait to share the experience with my significant other however i wouldnt recommend taking children as it can be quite disturbing for them as you explain that they are seeing dead bodies

el museo de las momias es bastante interesante ya que en ninguna parte del mundo suceden estas cosas con los cuerpos el museo no es la gran cosa es un poco tosco y sin chiste pero la exhibicion de las momias es buena por otra parte el museo adjunto a este el museo de la muerte es en verdad un fracasado intento de ganar un poco mas de dinero no posee nada interesante y es en verdad una perdida de tiempo no es recomendable gastar para verlo

guanajuato is one of the must beautiful cities i have seen we intentionally went there to visit the mummies for our anniversary the museum has many mummies all with names and pictures and stories beind them truly an experience not to be missed

si entre porque me daba morbo pero luego se transformo en pena y al final me reafirme en que queria ser incinerada pues no me gustaria que mi cuerpo acabara en un museo como una atraccion macabra no volveria

Titulo: the cult of the dead museum is a ripoff
Opinion: the museum of the mummies is very interesting and worth seeing if you are interested in such things the second museum cult of the deadculto de los muertes is a ripoff tacked on to the educational experience just a bunch of fake displays eg the skeleton of a person who supposedly died of radiation poisoning whose skeleton glows with a greenish light its only 10 pesos 1 more but not worth even that

i have enjoyed the mummy museum the several times i have visited however recently they gave the museum a face lift that only took 60 hours to complete and the ambiance that the museum once had has vanished granted the upgrade is very nice but with the marble floors nice halogen lighting set in fancy stainless steel hanging lamps and new positions for the mummies it doesnt feel like you are in the crypt the original layout allowed you to feel up close and personal with the mummies as you strolled through the musty dimlylit cement chambers obviously the mummies have not changed so the musuem really is a must if you can handle it i have seen many people leave abruptly a stroll through will make you reflect on your own mortality while understanding the fascinating mexican behaviors and concepts of death

i had always wanted to visit the mummies after reading about them as a girl so i went the first week in november to tie in with mexicos day of the dead they had a beautifully laid out day of the dead altar at the entrance along with poignant photos of traditional motherfather with dead children that was quite common for the times i did not find this museum grotesque or bizarre but a contemplation on the briefness of life of the soul and of the journey each of us take through time this museum would never be tolerated in the us due to political correctness and the idea of a distant relative being displayed as a mummy it works wonderfully in mexico particularly during day of the dead where relatives are truly honored with altars graveside gettogethers favorite foods i would recommend this museum

guanajuato its a pretty place but i felt a sinister athmosphere in all the town i never has been afraid about horror movies but this museum was my horror ultimate experience i agree with other ta members dont go with small childrens this place disturbing me for the next 2 nights i was thinking in the dead people because there are many mummies i know it is an educational and an archeological experience but bizzarre

Titulo: update re cost of museo de las momias
Opinion: went to the museum on may 2 2005 there are now two parts to the museum i was asked in spanish ambos museos which means both museums i responded in spanish asking about the difference between the two and the cost i was told there were new displays in the second museum that together it was 60 pesos i did not see anything different between the two sides of the museum if i had given it more thought at the time i would have realized that new mummies is a oxymoron i am not certain the ticket seller was bilingual so be prepared for the question

Titulo: the previous reviewer is just come on
Opinion: this place is of historical not hysterical importance mummies in egypt and elsewhere rate high on the education level

the museum is not for people who get scared really easy and for sure not for children under the age of 13 for the reason the museum really has dead people all the bodies were mumified naturally by the minerals in the soil where they were buried or killed the one i was most scared of was the lady who had died pregnant so you see her stomach caved in it takes about an hour just to look at all the mummies and it doesnt cost a lot to get in i cant remember the price though when i went there was a lot of people waiting in a line to get in but dont worry there are shops right next to the museum with people selling religious objects and objects that have to do with the dead i think it would be really cool to go their during the mexican holiday the day of the dead but yeah you should for sure go
